meanings.definition: In a loyal, reliable, and hardworking manner.
meanings.sent1: She worked stalwartly to complete the project on time.
meanings.sent2: He always completes his tasks stalwartly and without complaints.
meanings.sent3: The little ant stalwartly carried the heavy crumb back to its nest.
meanings.sent4: The old oak tree stood stalwartly against the strong winds.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter rushed stalwartly into the burning building to save the trapped cat.

meanings.sent1: The stalwartly friend never missed a birthday celebration.
meanings.sent2: Her stalwartly dedication to her studies earned her top grades.
meanings.sent3: The dog wagged its tail stalwartly as its owner returned home.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse stood stalwartly on the rocky shore, guiding ships safely.
meanings.sent5: The soldier's stalwartly bravery inspired his comrades in battle.

meanings.sent1: The stalwartly table held the weight of the heavy books.
meanings.sent2: The castle walls were stalwartly constructed to withstand attacks.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel tried to climb the stalwartly tree trunk but slipped.
meanings.sent4: The mountain stood stalwartly against the changing seasons.
meanings.sent5: The ship was stalwartly built to endure rough seas and storms.
